title: Instant Pot Best Beef Stew
description: This Instant Pot stew recipe is the ultimate, hearty, melt-in-your-mouth comfort food. It's so easy to make in an Instant Pot for a simple midweek dinner.
ingredient: ['1 tablespoon butter', '1 pound beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes', '4  Yukon Gold potatoes, cubed', '1 ½ cups mushrooms, halved', '1  onion, cut into 6 wedges', '2  carrots, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '3 cups beef broth', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 tablespoon tomato paste', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon dried rosemary']
direction:
['Gather all ingredients.











Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select the Sauté function. Melt butter in the pot. Cook beef chuck cubes in batches until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes per batch.











Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', 'Return all beef chuck cubes to the pot. Add potatoes, mushrooms, onion, carrots, and garlic; cover with beef broth. Stir in Worcestershire sauce, tomato paste, salt, pepper, and rosemary.











Dotdash Meredith Food Studios', "Close and lock the lid. Select Meat/Stew function, according to the manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 35 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.", "Release pressure using the natural-release method, according to the manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid."]
nutrition_detail: ['% Daily Value *', 'Total Fat 16g', 'Saturated Fat 7g', 'Cholesterol 59mg', 'Sodium 1321mg', 'Total Carbohydrate 32g', 'Dietary Fiber 4g', 'Total Sugars 5g', 'Protein 20g', 'Vitamin C 8mg', 'Calcium 49mg', 'Iron 3mg', 'Potassium 542mg']
time: {'Prep Time:': '20 mins', 'Cook Time:': '55 mins', 'Additional Time:': '10 mins', 'Total Time:': '1 hr 25 mins', 'Servings:': '4'}
label: ['Recipes', 'Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes', 'Stews', 'Beef']

The beef melts in your mouth.....'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'lornay'}, 'reviewBody': 'great recipe and so easy!'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'wayl0n'}, 'reviewBody': 'Very good and simple recipe, and very customizable as many have shared. I did follow another makers advice of 25min, but even then with natural release method I worried vegetables would be over done, so I quick released after 15min, and veggies a little over cooked. But the beef was fantastic, I chose to use chuck roast, i think a lot of grocers cut corners and use scrap beef as stew meat, and it was perfect. Added celery and bay leaves to ours and thickened a little at the end, also added a little heavy cream, very good….will make again with a few adjustments until we find our perfect fit…maybe red wine, maybe a beer. I used an angus beef stew meat that was tender and delicious. My Instapot was large enough to cook all the beef at once, so I did not cook in batches. Added a little Herb de Provence in addition to dried rosemary. Allowed to natural pressure release for 30 min, then released the rest quickly. Like others, I added a cornstarch/water blend to thicken. I did add 1/3 cup of red wine to the 4 tbsp flour to thicken a little bit. Otherwise, it was a hit.'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Kitchengnome'}, 'reviewBody': 'Did this just according to the recipe. Found the sauce to be too thin. Also, no stew can be made w/o celery if you are using onions and carrots! So I added 2 large ribs of celery, cut into 1/2" slices. I made a roux with flour, butter and a little red wine. I brought the whole pot up to a boil for about 5 min. and viola! The sauce was just right. My wife, who has hated stews all her life, loved it. She went so far as to say it was the best dish that I've ever made; and she likes my cooking.'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Dawn Cardin Ayrton'}, 'reviewBody': 'This was my first recipe in my instapot. Turned out awesome... next time I am going to experiment with diabetic friendly / keto thickeners.'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Gonzo'}, 'reviewBody': 'Great recipe and thank you to Fioa for sharing it. Peace and good health to you all!'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '1'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Diane Niebrzydowski-Feathersto'}, 'reviewBody': "It was soupy, very watery. I added a flour mixture to make a watery gravy, but I don't think it needs so much broth in the recipe!!! The flavor was good, though."}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '3'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Chris Geer'}, 'reviewBody': 'Meh- not bad but needs "something." Maybe add some red wine? Just kinda blah. Maybe I missed something.....'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '4'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Judith David'}, 'reviewBody': "Quite good. I used round steak cut in 1' cubes which I dusted with flour, salt, and ground pepper. Set the instant pot on saute and browned the meat in 3 smaller batches with 1 tbsp melted butter and olive oil. Added potatoes, baby carrots, onion, and garlic with 3 cups beef broth plus worcestershire sauce. Set pot on meat/stew setting and pressure cooked for 35 minutes, allowing 15 minutes to naturally release. After opening the pot, the gravy was thin so added a few Tbsp flour/water mix. Warmed to boiling fot several minutes to thicken. Meat was very tender; veggies were mushy (overcooked). Flavor was great! Next time I will cut the potatoes in half, not cubes and will use larger pieces of whole carrots . I left out the tomato paste. I will make again with a few small changes, reaching for 5 stars"}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Cindy Mitchell'}, 'reviewBody': 'Excellent.'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'GCrav'}, 'reviewBody': 'Great tasting stew!'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'LizzieD'}, 'reviewBody': 'Substituted beef broth with Better Than Bouillon seasoned vegetable base. Wife loved it, kids inhaled it and I'm looking forward to making it for the family again."}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '4'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Kristen Diesburg'}, 'reviewBody': "Pretty good! I didn't have all the ingredients on hand (no mushrooms or tomato) but will definitely make again. I also threw in a chopped jalapeno to heat it up a bit."}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '4'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Ann Naumann'}, 'reviewBody': 'Everyone enjoyed it,'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'sylvia c mraz'}, 'reviewBody': 'My husband and I love this recipe! I used hot salsa instead of the tomato paste and added 1 large chopped jalepeno. Also dusted the beef cubes in searing flour before browning them. Will definitely make this again!'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '3'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Schlomo Silverstein'}, 'reviewBody': 'Good baseplate InstaPot recipe. I have a 6qt and used a 2 lb Swiss steak, 1 lb large carrots 1/2" chopped, 1 lb yellow potatoes quartered, 2 large onions eighthed, and 6 cloves garlic minced. Even though I scaled up the meat, I only used 2 cups of broth, the vegetables sweat a lot so the end product had fluid covering everything. Browned the meat in batches, then lightly rolled in flour, deglazed with a splash of wine. Did as others commented, cooked meat for 25 min, natural released for 20, then put in vegetables for 8 min, and naturally released for 20. The meat was fall apart in your mouth, but not shredding, there was still a good hearty texture. The potatoes, carrots, and onions were very soft, I couldn't imagine them holding any texture if you cooked them much longer.'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Denise Pope'}, 'reviewBody': "Husband loved it, I didn't have mushrooms so those were left out. I did add a few pieces of celery. We will definitely make it again."}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '4'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'sheri'}, 'reviewBody': 'I used petite potato medley (whole, with skin) , baby carrots, and stewed tomatoes. Added can corn after cooking.
. Deleted onion and mushrooms.'}, {'@type': 'Review', 'reviewRating': {'@type': 'Rating', 'ratingValue': '5'}, 'author': {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Brent Gilmore'}, 'reviewBody': 'Only change is I coated the beef with coconut and almond flour to brown it. s&p 2/3 cup of flour, added season salt, dredged 2 lbs of stew meat in the mixture
Saute all meat, add back into pot, with 6 potatoes, 4 carrots. 3 stalks of celery, 1 chopped onion,
added beef stock, 3 Tbs worcestershire, 3 Tbs tomato paste, 3 cloves of garlic then added red wine until it almost covered everything. 
selected meat/stew on insta pot for 30 minutes. (It took 25 minutes to unpressure before I could open the lid) Added sliced mushrooms & peas. Turned on saute for 3 minutes.
 Next time I will try with 25 minutes because it was to long for the potatoes. In the future I may use a little red wine and decrease the beef broth to enhance the flavor. I also followed the recommendation of others and mixed 1/4 cup flour and salt and pepper in a plastic bag and shook the stew meat in it and then sauteed the meat. The flour helped thicken the sauce. The stew tasted even better the next day. I also used round steak instead of stew meat, and added some beef base to the broth. Beef came out tender! I agree with others that this is better if the broth is thickened. After mine was cooked and decompression was complete, I added 1/3 c flour mixed with a bit of water, and put it on saute until thickened. It came out really good and cooked in a very short time. description_additional: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select the Sauté function. Melt butter in the pot. Cook beef chuck cubes in batches until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes per batch.', 'Return all beef chuck cubes to the pot. Add potatoes, mushrooms, onion, carrots, and garlic; cover with beef broth. Stir in Worcestershire sauce, tomato paste, salt, pepper, and rosemary.', "Close and lock the lid. Select Meat/Stew function, according to the manufacturer's instructions; set the timer for 35 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.", "Release pressure using the natural-release method, according to the manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid."]
